p: In this induction model, the TNBS hapten penetrates the intestinal wall, resulting in the haptenization of proteins derived from the colon or microbiota. Subsequently, the generation of specific TCD4 + cells and antibodies is observed, making them immunogenic and triggering innate and adaptive immune responses in the host. Administration of TNBS leads to the development of a cell-mediated immune response that reflects a Th1 and Th17 phenotype of inflammation [ 67, 68].
